pullrequest.title: Allow specifying physics engine in sdf file

content.raw: If we create the `sdf::Physics` component I [mentioned](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/391/allow-specifying-physics-engine-in-sdf/diff?w=1#comment-110036349), then we can add that component to the world instead of having a physics entity. The SDF spec says a world can contain only one physics element, but I've seen world files that have [multiple](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/default/test/worlds/revolute_joint_test_with_large_gap.world) so, maybe we should make it `std::vector<sdf::Physics>`
